refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Copy files and directories to a target directory, PREFIX. The target subdirectory within PREFIX for a given path defaults to path:H and may be overridden by explicitly setting DIR.path for a particular source path.

File and directory modes are set as part of installation. Modes default to 644 and 755 for files and directories respectively, and may be overridden by explicitly setting MODE.path for a particular source path.
There is no dependency on installed files; paths are re-copied each time the install:: target is called, and removed each time the uninstall:: target is called..

refsection.title: Input
refsection.synopsis:
INSTALL ?= install
REMOVE ?= rm -f RMDIR ?= rmdir
PREFIX = dir STAGE_BUILD += path_build STAGE_COPY += path_copy
DIR.path ?= ${path:H} MODE.file ?= 644 MODE.dir ?= 755
${BUILD}/path_build: path_copy:
